action.action-desc: Mr. Russell (for himself and Mr. Connolly) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To ensure the effective processing of mail by Federal agencies, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Agency Mail Management Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Section 9 of the Presidential and Federal Records Act Amendments of 2014 (44 U.S.C. 101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by amending paragraph (3) to read as follows:
in paragraph (7), by striking the Administrator or the Archivist and inserting the Archivist or the Administrator.

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (a) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Archivist shall provide guidance and assistance to Federal agencies with respect to ensuring—

paragraph.text: adequate and proper documentation of the policies and transactions of the Federal Government; and

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) and (3) as paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively;
by inserting after paragraph (1), the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking effective records management by such agencies and inserting effective processing of mail by Federal agencies;

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by striking subsections (a) and (b) and inserting subsection (a); and
in subparagraph (B), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), as so redesignated, by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by inserting at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: by inserting at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: The Administrator, in carrying out subsection (b), shall have the responsibility to promote economy and efficiency in the selection and utilization of space, staff, equipment, and supplies for processing mail at Federal facilities.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking ; and at the end and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (2), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by inserting at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: by inserting at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: The Administrator (or the Administrator’s designee) may inspect the mail processing practices and programs of any Federal agency for the purpose of rendering recommendations for the improvement of mail processing practices and programs. Officers and employees of such agencies shall cooperate fully in such inspections of mail processing practices and programs.
The amendments made by this section shall take effect as if included in the Presidential and Federal Records Act Amendments of 2014 (Public Law 113–187).
